Because reviewing is most helpful otherwise--you see how others think, get a better grasp of the literature, maybe figure out methods issues, etc.
If admin, possibly director of grad program--you learn your own program, how to divvy up $, etc.

text:
Because people are concerned that they might get cited for making an argument that they may change later on.
Not realizing that plenty of scholars end up being on both sides of a debate.
I remember having my name in someone's presentation filling two boxes--pro & con.
author: smsaideman

text:
Senior folks?  If they do it, well, they have jobs and probably tenure.  

But for junior folks, this "do not cite" thing is not good for your career.

Don't worry about your paper being incomplete, imperfect or even wrong.  Get your ideas out, stake your claims, get cited.
author: smsaideman

text:
Dear junior ISA-attendees,
best way to ensure people don't cite your work is to put "do not cite" on your paper.  Given that cites accumulate over time AND some places really care about them for tenure and such, better to risk an imperfect paper getting more attention than not
author: smsaideman
